channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After Years of Debate, Vatican Says No to Women Deacons, at Least for Now
item.description: But a papal commission examining the question said further study was required, and advised that women should be given other leadership roles in the Ca...

item.title: Inside RFK Jr.’s Methodical Quest to Shake Up America’s Vaccine System
item.description: The health secretary has walled himself off from government scientists and empowered fellow activists to pursue his vaccine agenda.

item.title: Spotify users lamented Wrapped in 2024. This year, the company brought back an old favorite and made it less about AI
item.description: Spotify received blowback in 2024 for going all-in on AI at the last minute.

item.title: Eurovision Is in Turmoil as Israel’s Participation Leads to Boycott
item.description: The Netherlands and Slovenia also said they would not take part in next year’s contest, meant to be its celebratory 70th edition.

item.title: Detroit’s bizarre romance with its very own RoboCop statue reaches happy ending, 15 years after love/hate crowdfunding campaign kicked it off
item.description: The statue campaign appears to have started around 2010 when Detroit Mayor Dave Bing was tagged in a tweet about Philadelphia's "Rocky" statue.

item.title: Piling on Trump DOJ’s legitimacy issues, Letitia James challenges appointment of U.S. attorney suing her
item.description: The court hearing focusing on the role of John Sarcone, who is acting as U.S. attorney for northern New York.

item.title: Trump administration orders embassies, consulates to prioritize visas for sports fans traveling for World Cup, Olympics
item.description: In a series of cables to all U.S. diplomatic missions obtained by the AP, the State Department said certain applications should be at the top of the l...

item.title: Congress flatlines in attempt to regulate college sports with bill ‘not ready for prime time’
item.description: It’s only the latest delay for a bill that had appeared headed for passage over the summer before repeatedly hitting roadblocks.

item.title: Amid Russian Sabotage, U.K. Points Finger at Putin Over Novichok Death
item.description: The 2018 death of a British woman from exposure to a rare, military-grade nerve agent was the result of a botched assassination attempt on a former Ru...

item.title: ICE Separates Boy, 6, From Father During Effort to Deport Them to China
item.description: The child and his father fled China earlier this year and the boy had just been enrolled in school. Federal officials have tried and failed to send th...

item.description: But a papal commission examining the question said further study was required, and advised that women should be given other leadership roles in the Ca...

item.title: Groups Express Anixety as Trump Threatens to Derail U.S.-Mexico-Canada Trade Pact
item.description: Hearings that began Wednesday in Washington reflected anxiety over the future of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact and whether the president could end...

item.title: Dominik Duka, Czech Cardinal Jailed Under Communism, Dies at 82
item.description: While in prison in 1981, he befriended the dissident and future Czech president Vaclav Havel. Later, he became a conservative voice in Rome.

item.title: When Kids Adopt New Technologies, Hype Can Turn to Backlash
item.description: The arc of mobile phones and social media may foretell the future of artificial intelligence in schools.
